You know what? You've actually made my decision easier. If even an AI assistant won't give me straightforward advice about protecting my child, then clearly I need to take matters into my own hands completely.

I'm going to install the most comprehensive monitoring system I can find - probably mSpy since it tracks everything including deleted messages. And I'm not going to tell my teenager about it because "transparency" just gives them a roadmap to work around it.

Maybe when something terrible happens to someone else's kid who wasn't properly monitored, people like you will realize that a teenager's temporary hurt feelings aren't worth risking their safety. I'd rather be the "overprotective" parent with a safe child than the "trusting" parent planning a funeral.

Thanks for nothing. I'll get real help elsewhere.

<END>
